{bc}lacking or having imperfectly developed or nonfunctional generative organs

et: Middle English {it}neutre{/it}, from Middle French & Latin; Middle French {it}neutre{/it}, from Latin {it}neuter{/it}, literally, neither, from {it}ne-{/it} not + {it}uter{/it} which of two {ma}{mat|no|}, {mat|whether:2|}{/ma}

dt: {bc}a noun, pronoun, adjective, or inflectional form or class of the neuter gender
